passages.text: China (PRC) | Cosmetics, Household & Personal Care Mao Geping
More Color on FY25 Guidance

MGP's 1H25 results were at the midpoint of prelim results. Mgmt provided more details about FY25 guidance with \(30\% +\) growth expected for both rev and NP. Mgmt targets net opening of 30 stores per year. Its first official HK counter is scheduled to open on 1 Oct in Harbour City. PT fine- tuned to HK \(\) 130\(. Maintain Buy with MGP as our top pick in China Beauty.

Post release of full- set 1H25 results, MGP hosted an earnings call in the afternoon of 28 Aug. 1H25 revenue and net profit were at the mid- point of its prelim results (see here), which was released on 12 Aug.

Revenue came in at Rmb2.59bn, up by \(31\%\) YoY (makeup \(+31\%\) , skincare \(+33\%\) ) in 1H25. GPM of \(84.2\%\) contracted by 0.7ppt YoY (dragged by makeup), due to product upgrade and cost increase (- 0.49ppt) and not fully utilized makeup artistry (- 0.25ppt), per mgmt. S&D expense ratio was \(45.2\%\) , an improvement of 2.36ppt YoY, thanks to diversified omni- channel strategy and brand building starting to bear fruit, per mgmt. Net profit of Rmb670mn grew by \(36\%\) YoY and NPM was \(25.9\%\) .
Overall repurchase rate increased to \(26.8\%\) in 1H25 (vs. \(24.8\%\) in 1H24), primarily thanks to improvement at online (see Chart 4), in our view.

More details were provided on guidance during the call. Mgmt took the opportunity to provide more details about its guidance to investors, with \(30\% +\) growth expected for 2025 revenue and net profit (vs. prior guidance 3- yr CAGR of \(30\%\) based on 2023 results), which implies a slight uptick.

Mgmt also unveiled its store opening plan. It targets net opening of 30 stores per year with more focus on customer repurchase. It also indicated ST target of 600 stores and potential 1,000 locations for MGP brand. In our view, offline channel is important for MGP (to recap, offline channel mix \(\sim 47\%\) in 1H25), significantly different from other local beauty brands. In addition, we view its online channel could benefit from offline channel, evident from \(39\%\) growth in 1H25 at its online channel (Douyin \(+44\%\) , Tmall \(+33\%\) ).

Overseas network expansion: This July marks the first anniversary of MGP's entrance into the Hong Kong market. By teaming up with Sephora. On the call, mgmt indicated its official HK counter will open on 1 Oct in Harbour City. Network expansion to Singapore, Japan, France and UK are also on mgmt's schedule.
Incentive plan is expected to be announced soon to attract talent for better business development. Dividend policy: Mgmt suggested \(30\% +\) dividend payout ratio for 2025.

ModelRevisions: In this update, we fine- tuned our earnings sets \(+4 / + 2 / - 1\%\) for 2025E/26E/27E to factor in our assumptions of: 1) less store opening, 2) GPM contraction, 3) less S&D ratio due to better- than- expected operation efficiency. PT adjusted to HK\\$130. MGP is currently trading at \(30\times 25x\) PE in 2026E/27E supported by its premium brand equity, strong growth momentum, overseas branding expansion and mgmt's solid execution. Maintain Buy with MGP as our top pick in the China Beauty sector.
Please see analyst certifications, important disclosure information, and information regarding the status of non-Us analysts on pages 5 - 10 of this report. \\* Jefferies Hong Kong Limited

Chart 1 - 1-year anniversary: MGP entered Hong Kong via Sephora
MGP is the No.1 and only domestic player with premium beauty positioning in China, in terms of group, brand, and channel.

MGP's vision is to become a top- tier premium Chinese beauty group by 2035, supported by three pillars: 1) MGP's influential IP power and strong brand presence in beauty, 2) its solid competitive edge in the offline channel, and 3) category expansion beyond beauty.
Risk/Reward - 12 Month View
MGP delivers top- tier growth, with further potential for growth, most notably in makeup and skincare.
DCF- based PT of HK\$130 implies a target valuation of 39x 2026 P/E, which is at a premium to domestic beauty peers for owned brands and above peers' median in sales growth trend.
Faster- than- expected sales growth in makeup and skincare categories.
New perfume and home fragrance business sees accelerating sales growth.
Better- than- expected recovery in consumer demand for beauty products and MGP brand.
DCF- based PT of HK\$150, which translates into 45x 2026 P/E.
Slower- than- expected sales growth in skincare and makeup sectors.
More competition in new business and customer acquisition, as well as market share expansion.
Unexpected mgmt/key personnel changes and shareholding reductions.
Slower- than- expected recovery in consumer demand.
DCF- based PT of HK\$75, which translates into 23x 2026 P/E.
Top Material Issues: 1) Product and service quality remain highly important issues to MGP, 2) sustainable supply chain is pivotal in providing customers with high- quality products and services.

Company Target(s): 1) In 2024, mgmt set a target for water use efficiency, aiming to reduce water consumption and enhance water use efficiency through water- saving measures; 2) emission targets have been set by mgmt and steps have been taken to achieve them; and 3) targets to reduce hazardous and non- hazardous waste have been set by mgmt and steps have been taken to achieve them.

Qsto Mgmt: How can you encourage more sustainable behavior once the products are in the hands of the consumers? 2) Are you reacting fast/agile enough, particularly on procuring raw materials and reducing virgin plastic use once the co- starts directly engaging in manufacturing activities? 3) How do you conduct animal testing while upholding animal ethics and ensuring animal welfare?

- Incentive plan announcement- Overseas expansion- Retail sales performance during shopping festivals, including the upcoming D11- New SKU/collection launches- M&A activities- Read-across from industry peers' earnings releases- Possible shareholding reduction activities- China consumption recovery patch

Mao GepingMao Geping is a leading Chinese premium beauty group, founded in 2000 by Mr. Mao Geping, a renowned makeup artist with strong presence in China. According to Frost & Sullivan, the group is the only domestic market player among the Top 10 premium beauty groups in China, ranked No.7 with \(1.8\%\) market share in terms of total retail sales of all premium brands owned by each group in 2023. MAOGEPING, the group's flagship brand, was launched in 2000 and is the first domestic premium beauty brand in China.

Our primary valuation methodology is DCF, applying a WACC of \(8.9\%\) , with a COE of \(8.9\%\) , a beta of 0.9, and a terminal growth rate of 2.0 (TGR is in line with our range of \(0 - 3\%\) for China consumer stocks).

Risks include IP/Founder risk, single- brand concentration risk, risk to MGP brand equity, consumer complaints, intense competition, overreliance on KOLs for marketing and evolving regulations, demand for MGP products, lack of continued product upgrades and innovations, failure to adapt to consumer preferences in a timely manner, and uncertainty related to expansion strategies for domestic and overseas beauty markets.
(Article 3(1) the and Article 7 of MAR) Recommendation Published Recommendation Distributed

Buy - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of \(15\%\) or more within a 12- month period. Hold - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of plus \(15\%\) or minus \(10\%\) within a 12- month period. Underperform - Describes securities that we expect to provide a total return (price appreciation plus yield) of minus \(10\%\) or less within a 12- month period. The expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) for Buy rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) is \(20\%\) or more within a 12- month period as these companies are typically more volatile than the overall stock market. For Hold rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is plus or minus \(20\%\) within a 12- month period. For Underperform rated securities with an average security price consistently below \(10\) , the expected total return (price appreciation plus yield) is minus \(20\%\) or less within a 12- month period.
NR - The investment rating and price target have been temporarily suspended. Such suspensions are in compliance with applicable regulations and/or Jefferies policies.
CS - Coverage Suspended. Jefferies has suspended coverage of this company.
NC - Not covered. Jefferies does not cover this company.

Restricted - Describes issuers where, in conjunction with Jefferies engagement in certain transactions, company policy or applicable securities regulations prohibit certain types of communications, including investment recommendations.
Monitor - Describes securities whose company fundamentals and financials are being monitored, and for which no financial projections or opinions on the investment merits of the company are provided.

Jefferies' methodology for assigning ratings may include the following: market capitalization, maturity, growth/value, volatility and expected total return over the next 12 months. The price targets are based on several methodologies, which may include, but are not restricted to, analyses of market risk, growth rate, revenue stream, discounted cash flow (DCF), EBITDA, EPS, cash flow (CF), free cash flow (FCF), EV/EBITDA, P/E, PE/growth, P/CF, P/FCF, premium (discount)/average group EV/EBITDA, premium (discount)/average group P/E, sum of the parts, net asset value, dividend returns, and return on equity (ROE) over the next 12 months.

Jefferies Franchise Picks include stock selections from among the best stock ideas from our equity analysts over a 12 month period. Stock selection is based on fundamental analysis and may take into account other factors such as analyst conviction, differentiated analysis, a favorable risk/reward ratio and investment themes that Jefferies analysts are recommending. Jefferies Franchise Picks will include only Buy rated stocks and the number can vary depending on analyst recommendations for inclusion. Stocks will be added as new opportunities arise and removed when the reason for inclusion changes, the stock has met its desired return, if it is no longer rated Buy and/or if it triggers a stop loss. Stocks having 120 day volatility in the bottom quartile of S&P stocks will continue to have a 15% stop loss, and the remainder will have a 20% stop. Franchise Picks are not intended to represent a recommended portfolio of stocks and is not sector based, but we may note where we believe a Pick falls within an investment style such as growth or value.
Distribution of Ratings
